meanings.definition: Serving as a guardian or protector.
meanings.sent1: The tutelary angel watched over the children as they played in the park.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse stood as a tutelary beacon, guiding ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy dog took on a tutelary role, making sure the kitten didn't get into trouble.
meanings.sent4: Her smile acted as a tutelary shield, protecting her from the harsh words around her.
meanings.sent5: The old tree served as a tutelary presence, sheltering the animals from the storm.

meanings.definition: A deity or spirit that serves as a guardian or protector.
meanings.sent1: In ancient folklore, the villagers believed in a powerful tutelary who watched over their crops.
meanings.sent2: The small shrine was dedicated to the tutelary of the forest, offering prayers for protection.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gnome claimed to be the tutelary of the garden, ensuring the flowers bloomed beautifully.
meanings.sent4: The wise owl was seen as a tutelary figure, guiding travelers through the dark woods.
meanings.sent5: The ancient statue represented the tutelary of the sea, its gaze forever fixed on the horizon.
